page.title: 15NAMES AND LANES IN CLANFIELD
page.content: Numerous lanes and footpaths bear old names.Thieves Lane is reputed to have been the lair of highwaymen.Lime Kiln Lane was the track taken by the lime kiln burners of which there were many.No information can be obtained about the footpath leading to Dead Womans Gate.Cannon Ball Corner,also known as the Warn Cannon Bow has two legends.One that a cart load of cannon balls tipped over there and the other a spot reached by a cannon ball fired from Portsmouth.Hogs Lodge (formerly Hog) could be from the celtic HOEG meaning an ancient burial ground or from HOWEN,a general in charge of the nearby Roman camp site.The lanes leading to the view points become congested with visitors at weekends and hazardous in the winter months especially after a snowfall.
